definition: without doubt/with full self-confidence/forty years of age

sentences.english: Well-operated investment distinguishes one from others between retiring in his 40's or his 60's.
sentences.chinese: 巧妙投資，你在不惑之年或花甲退休就會體會到區別。

sentences.english: Till brother two already passed not of be puzzled year, they just knew the existence of the other side.
sentences.chinese: 直到兄弟兩已過不惑之年，他們才知道了對方的存在。

sentences.english: But I have no interest in history at all.
sentences.chinese: 可是我時歷史一點兒都不惑興趣。

sentences.english: Forty years old, it is said that it means a man would not doubt everything.
sentences.chinese: 四十歲，有人說這是個不惑之年。

sentences.english: The other inspiration is a Chinese saying, "At 40, one should be no longer confused."
sentences.chinese: 另外一個靈感是一句中國諺語，“四十不惑。”

sentences.english: Fathers are also increasingly likely to be close to middle age when they are faced with bringing up young children.
sentences.chinese: 年近不惑同時又要養育小孩的爸爸也越來越多。

sentences.english: No doubt we tasted the sour, sweet, bitter, hot, cold and engraved ring.
sentences.chinese: 不惑的我們嚐遍了酸甜苦辣，冷暖禍福刻滿了年輪。

sentences.english: If you invest your money wisely, you will experience the difference between retiring in your 40's or your 60's.
sentences.chinese: 巧妙投資，你在不惑之年或花甲退休就會體會到區別。

sentences.english: The other inspiration is a Chinese saying, “At 40, one should be no longer confused.
sentences.chinese: 另外一個靈感是一句中國諺語，“四十不惑。”

sentences.english: Jules, the story's narrator, is an actress in her late thirties.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事的敘述者朱爾斯是個年近不惑的女演員。

definition: thirty years old and therefore independent (idiom, from Confucius)
lit. one's youth will never return/to make the most of one's opportunities (idiom)
whatever you like/to do as one pleases
white hair and gray sunken cheeks (idiom); decrepit old age
